the ... in some ways the,

1566.75.text:
HEFFNER: We're running
out of time,

1568.75.text:
but it, it seems to me ...
documented or undocumented ...

1571.76.text:
immigrants are going to
enrich the spirit and body

1576.36.text:
BLACC: The history of
immigration is that

1583.10.text:
And labor is, is one of the
most important points in

1589.50.text:
immigration. People are
looking for work.

1591.97.text:
And I know I
wouldn't be here if
it wasn't for forced

1595.31.text:
labor, so we have to be
conscious and cognizant of

1599.05.text:
the history of labor and
America and we have to do,

1603.68.text:
what I believe is right,
in making available to

1607.09.text:
people who are looking
for work, and giving them

1610.56.text:
the opportunity to
have that work.

1612.56.text:
HEFFNER: Aloe Blacc you
are as elegant and
eloquent on the radio

1616.63.text:
as you are in person
here today.

1618.63.text:
And I really appreciate your
time and your thoughtfulness

1621.93.text:
BLACC: Great, thank
you so much.

1624.94.text:
And thanks to you in
the audience.

1626.94.text:
I hope you join us
again next time...

1628.94.text:
for a thoughtful
excursion into the
world of ideas.

1632.24.text:
Until then, keep
an open mind.
